alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Monroe; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:33PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Russell, north central Monroe, northern Cumberland, Metcalfe and Adair Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 932 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 7 miles south of Edmonton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Russell, Metcalfe, north central Monroe, northern Cumberland and Adair Counties, including the following locations... Pickett, Christine, Portland, Cundiff, Gadberry, Curtis, Absher, Willow Shade, Bliss and Grider. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
